message.content:
We begin by noting that the only information that involves Janice is:

 • “Janice is Nicholas’s descendant.”

Later in the list we also learn that:

 • “Nicholas is Shirley’s descendant.”

This gives us an ancestral chain for Janice:
 Shirley → … → Nicholas → Janice.
(We also have an earlier fact “Madison is Shirley’s ancestor” implying that Shirley, and hence her descendants, come from an even earlier generation. So Janice’s ancestral line actually includes Shirley and Madison, among possibly others.)

Now turning to Grace, the only fact involving her is:

 • “Gloria is Grace’s ancestor.”

And we also have:

 • “Kathleen is Gloria’s ancestor.”

Thus Grace’s chain is:
 Kathleen → Gloria → Grace.

Comparing the two chains we obtain:
 • Janice’s ancestors include Nicholas, Shirley (and via Shirley, even Madison, etc.)
 • Grace’s ancestors include Gloria and Kathleen.

None of the names in the Janice line appear in the Grace line (and vice‐versa), and none of the given chain facts show that one of these individuals is an ancestor or descendant of the other.

Therefore, Janice is not a descendant of Grace, nor is she an ancestor. There is no statement that gives Janice and Grace a common descendant or a common ancestor.

Thus, the correct answer is:

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
